page.title: 19SCHOOLS and ENVIRONMENT
page.content: { Prenton Primary School}was built in 1954. It houses two schools, infants and juniors, with two headteachers . There are nearly 3OO infants from 4\ to 8 years and 176 juniors from 8 to 11 years. The pupils live in the surrounding estates. The juniors have two classes in each of the three years. At the age of 11+ the children transfer to one of six comprehensive schools in Birkenhead. { St Michael & All Angels' Junior {School}in Woodchurch was opened in 1956, but in 1973 the present building was erected, to house a rapidly growing school. It now has 137 pupils on roll, aged from 8 to 11 years. { Higher Bebington Junior School}was opened in 1914. There are about 200 pupils, aged from 7 to 11 years. At 11+, children are selected to attend grammar or secondary modern schools.
